data.title: Acid Oxide Chemical Names
data.stubGenerator:
read nonmetalNum:int nonmetal:word(100)
read oxideNum:int
write answer
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> An integer [[nonmetalNum]] and string [[nonmetal]] for the <<number>> and name of the nonmetal, separated by a space
<<Line 2:>> An integer [[oxideNum]] for the oxide <<number>>
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> A string [[answer]] for the standard name of the acid oxide

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

In chemistry, the acid oxides are named with this rule:

• Conditional prefix representing nonmetalNum + name of nonmetal +
• Prefix representing oxideNum + oxide

More specifically, prefixes represent the number of the nonmetal or oxide:

• If number is 1: mon for oxide only; no need to add for nonmetal
• If number is 2: di
• If number is 3: tri
• If number is 4: tetr
• If number is 5: pent

Note: Chemical names go higher, but we will stop at 5.
Input
Line 1: An integer nonmetalNum and string nonmetal for the number and name of the nonmetal, separated by a space
Line 2: An integer oxideNum for the oxide number
Output
Line 1: A string answer for the standard name of the acid oxide
Constraints
1 ≤ nonmetalNum ≤ 5
1 ≤ oxideNum ≤ 5
Example
Input
1 carbon
2
Output
carbon dioxide
